Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole pitched seven innings, holding the Kansas City Royals to a single run and leading the New York Yankees to a 3-1 victory.
Clay Holmes tossed a perfect eighth inning and Luke Weaver breezed through the ninth, extending the scoreless streak by Yankees relievers to 15 and two-thirds innings this postseason.
Juan Soto, Gleyber Torres, and Giancarlo Stanton drove in runs for the Yankees.
Michael Wacha allowed two runs, six hits, and a walk over less than five innings for Kansas City.
Anthony Volpe's single in the fifth inning led to a two-out single by Gleyber Torres, making the score 2-0 and ending Wacha's night.
Giancarlo Stanton extended the lead to 3-0 with his single in the sixth inning.
A near-fracas occurred in the bottom of the sixth inning after Anthony Volpe's hard tag on Maikel Garcia, leading to players spilling out of both dugouts.
Bobby Witt Jr. and Vinnie Pasquantino had hits in the sixth inning, with Pasquantino driving in a run to make it 3-1.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees manager Aaron Boone expressed pride in his team and excitement about playing in the ALCS.
Aaron Judge reflected on the team's determination to not miss the postseason again after their 2023 season ended without a playoff appearance.
Royals manager Matt Quatraro expressed sympathy for his players, acknowledging their effort and energy throughout the season.
Giancarlo Stanton emphasized the importance of winning and not wanting to feel the disappointment that Kansas City felt.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New York Yankees clinched a spot in their fourth ALCS in eight years.
Kansas City did not win a home game after 8 September, losing nine in a row including the playoffs.
Kansas City made its first postseason appearance since winning the 2015 World Series.
